definition: (of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: My song has put off her adornments . She has no pride of dress and decoration.
sentences.chinese: 我的詩歌卸掉妝飾，她沒有衣飾的驕傲。

sentences.english: Therefore the people of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments, from Mount Horeb onward .
sentences.chinese: 以色列人從住何烈山以後，就把身上的妝飾摘得乾淨。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty was a blooming period of women′s toilette, especially in painting eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 唐代是婦女妝飾十分繁盛的一個時期，尤以眉妝爲最。

sentences.english: When the people heard these distressing words, they began to mourn and no one put on any ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 百姓聽見這凶信就悲哀，也沒有人佩戴妝飾。

sentences.english: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said
sentences.chinese: 有人談論聖殿，是用美石和供物妝飾的。

sentences.english: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 你要以榮耀莊嚴爲妝飾，以尊榮威嚴爲衣服。

sentences.english: Again you will adorn yourself with your tambourines And will go forth in the dance of those who make merry .
sentences.chinese: 你必再以自己的鼓爲妝飾，與歡笑的人一同跳舞而出。

sentences.english: Do not adorn yourselves outwardly by braiding your hair, by wearing gold ornaments,or fine clothing.
sentences.chinese: 你們不要以外面的辮頭髮，戴金飾，穿美衣，爲妝飾。

sentences.english: The adornments which the Father gives to his daughters and sons are carved and painted in the deepest recesses of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 父神給他兒女的妝飾，總是雕繪於心靈的最深之處。

sentences.english: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
sentences.chinese: 借他的靈使天有妝飾，他的手刺殺快蛇。

sentences.english: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
sentences.chinese: 我們要爲你作金的妝飾物，用銀星來點綴。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
fire and candles/household things that burn
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
